etymologies: 1950s; earliest use found in Antibiotics & Chemotherapy. Origin uncertain; probably from novo- + bio- + -cin (in -mycin)

definitions: A weakly acidic tetracyclic phenol, C₃₁ H₃₆ N₂ O₁₁, that is produced by certain actinomycetes of the genus Streptomyces and is used in treating infections caused by bacteria resistant to less toxic antibiotics.
